sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Newes from Smith the Oxford jaylor. With the arraignment of Mercurius Aulicus, who is sentenced to stand in the pillory three market dayes, for his notorious libelling against state and kingdome.
8 p.
Printed for J. B., London : 1645.
Mercurius Aulicus is a work by John Birkenhead. Cf. DNB. Annotation on Thomason copy: the 5 in imprint date is crossed out and altered to 1644; "Feb: 5th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Printed for J. B., London : 1645.
